search.filters.dateHelp: Select a time period to filter memories
search.filters.typeTip: Filter by the type of content stored

documents.title: üìÑ Document Ingestion
documents.dropSubtitle: or <button id="fileSelectBtn" class="link-button">browse to select files</button>
documents.supported: Supported formats: PDF, TXT, MD, JSON
documents.tagsHelp: Tags will be applied to all files. Use spaces or commas as separators.
documents.modeDescription: All selected files will be processed together with the same tags.
documents.chunkHelp.title: üìö Chunking Configuration Guide
documents.chunkHelp.note: Note: Actual chunk sizes may vary as the system respects paragraph boundaries to maintain semantic coherence.
documents.chunkHelp.defaultBest: Best for: Technical documentation, reference manuals, knowledge bases
documents.chunkHelp.defaultWhy: Why: Paragraph-aware chunking preserves complete thoughts and context
documents.chunkHelp.smallBest: Best for: Dense technical docs, code documentation, API references
documents.chunkHelp.smallTradeoff: Trade-off: More granular retrieval but may split paragraphs more aggressively
documents.chunkHelp.largeBest: Best for: Narrative documents, articles, blogs, long-form content
documents.chunkHelp.largeTradeoff: Trade-off: Better context but less precise retrieval
documents.chunkHelp.tipOverlap: Overlap helps maintain context across chunk boundaries
documents.chunkHelp.tipHigherOverlap: Higher overlap = better continuity but more redundancy
documents.chunkHelp.tipTest: Test different settings on a sample document to find optimal configuration
documents.chunkHelp.tipPreserve: Chunks preserve complete sentences and paragraphs when possible
documents.overlapHelp.title: üîó Chunk Overlap Explained
documents.overlapHelp.note: What is overlap? Overlap is the number of characters that are duplicated between consecutive chunks. This helps maintain context across chunk boundaries.
documents.overlapHelp.noneBest: Best for: Maximum storage efficiency, no redundancy needed
documents.overlapHelp.noneTradeoff: Trade-off: Context may be lost at chunk boundaries
documents.overlapHelp.mediumBest: Best for: Most documents - balances context and efficiency
documents.overlapHelp.mediumWhy: Why: Preserves 1-2 sentences of context across boundaries
documents.overlapHelp.highBest: Best for: Complex technical content requiring maximum context
documents.overlapHelp.highTradeoff: Trade-off: More storage and processing, higher redundancy
documents.overlapHelp.tipRule: Rule of thumb: Overlap should be 15-25% of chunk size
documents.overlapHelp.tipAccuracy: Higher overlap helps with search accuracy but increases storage
documents.overlapHelp.tipZero: Zero overlap is fine for well-structured documents with clear sections
documents.processingHelp.note: When uploading multiple files, choose how they should be processed. Both modes apply the same tags to all files.
documents.processingHelp.batchWhat: What it does: Uploads all files together as one operation
documents.processingHelp.batchBest: Best for: Similar files, fast bulk processing, when you want files grouped together
documents.processingHelp.batchCons: Cons: One file failure can affect the whole batch
documents.processingHelp.individualWhat: What it does: Uploads each file separately with individual API calls
documents.processingHelp.individualBest: Best for: Mixed file types, when you want error isolation, or need individual progress tracking
documents.processingHelp.individualPros: Pros: Better error handling, individual progress, more robust
documents.processingHelp.individualCons: Cons: Slightly slower due to sequential processing
documents.processingHelp.tipBatch: Batch mode: When files are similar and you want them processed quickly together
documents.processingHelp.tipIndividual: Individual mode: When files might have different processing requirements or you want to ensure all files get processed even if some fail
documents.processingHelp.tipSingle: Single files: Always processed individually (no choice needed)
documents.processingHelp.tipTags: Both modes apply the same tags to all files
documents.searchDesc: Search within your uploaded documents to verify content is indexed
documents.searchPlaceholder: Search for content within ingested documents...

api.events.stream: Subscribe to real-time memory events stream
